ui.settings.unsaved_changes: You have unsaved settings changes, would you like to save them now?
ui.settings.game.field_of_view.name: Field of View
ui.settings.game.field_of_view.descripti:
How large the FOV for the player is.
I would not recommend changing this much from the default value, but you do you.
ui.settings.game.sensitivity.name: Sensitivity
Horizontal only.
Multiplicative with overall sensitivity.
ui.settings.game.sensitivity.vertical.de:
Vertical Sensitivity only.
Multiplicative with overall sensitivity.
ui.settings.game.sensitivity.aiming.name: Aim Scale
ui.settings.game.sensitivity.aiming.desc: Multiplier to your sensitivity while aiming. (e.g. drawing back a bow and arrow).
ui.settings.game.dynamic_post_processing:
Some things in the game will apply some fairly drastic post processing or particle effects to your camera.
If you don't want to see any of that you can disable it here.
ui.settings.game.camera_effects.name: Camera Motion
ui.settings.game.camera_effects.descript:
Enable or disable all camera motion.
Camera motion includes things like moving your camera when you take damage, land an attack, block an attack, etc.
ui.settings.game.view_bob.name: View Bob
ui.settings.game.view_bob.description:
How much view-bob should you experience?
User preference - I don't give a shit <3
ui.settings.game.aim_punch.name: Aim Punch
ui.settings.game.aim_punch.description:
How strong aim punch effects will be when applied to your camera.
Taking damage, hitting an attack and blocking all cause aim punch.
I would recommend leaving this at default until you've tried the game a bit.
ui.settings.game.camera_shake.name: Camear Shake
ui.settings.game.camera_shake.descriptio:
How much camera shake should you experience?
Camera shake is apllied when hitting attacks, taking, damage, certain scripted sequences, etc.
I would recommend leaving this at default until you've tried the game a bit.
ui.settings.game.auto_hotbar.name: Auto Hotbar
ui.settings.game.auto_hotbar.description: Automatically add eligible items to your hotbar when picked up. (e.g. potions, consumables, etc)
ui.settings.game.auto_level.name: Auto Level
ui.settings.game.auto_level.description:
Automatically level up your starting class when you gain a level.
There's only one class in the game at the moment, so there's not much point in letting you choose what class to level.
In the future we plan to support multiclassing but until that's implemented this is will be on by default.
ui.settings.ui.hud.name: Show HUD
ui.settings.ui.hud.description:
Turn this off to disable the HUD.
I have no idea who wants this but here you go.
ui.settings.ui.hud.centralized.name: Centered
ui.settings.ui.hud.centralized.descripti:
Centers your [key.stat.health] and [key.stat.stamina] bars on your screen.
Some people prefer this so I've added an option for it.
ui.settings.ui.hud.vertical_offset.name: Vertical Offset
ui.settings.ui.hud.vertical_offset.descr: How high above the bottom of your screen your [key.stat.health] and [key.stat.stamina] bars will be.
ui.settings.ui.hud.scale.name: Scale
ui.settings.ui.hud.scale.description: The size of the HUD elements on your screen.
ui.settings.ui.show_crosshair.name: Show Crosshair
ui.settings.ui.show_crosshair.descriptio: Disabling his will hide the crosshair that appears in the center of your screen.
ui.settings.ui.show_crosshair.show_aim_p: Shows an indicator for which direction your [key.flag.melee] attacks will come from.
ui.settings.ui.show_crosshair.size.name: Size
ui.settings.ui.show_info_panels.name: Show Info Panels
ui.settings.ui.show_info_panels.descript: Whether to show information about what you're looking at (e.g. enemy name and level)
ui.settings.ui.show_info_panels.always_s: If enabled, we will always show info panels while they're within range.
If enabled, the info panels will always show the actors name and level.
ui.settings.ui.show_info_panels.status_e: If enabled, you will be able to see status effects currently affecting a target in their info panel.
ui.settings.ui.show_interaction_reminder: Show reminders for the controls when interacting with objects in the world.
ui.settings.ui.show_damage_numbers.name: Damage Numbers
ui.settings.ui.show_damage_numbers.descr:
Show damage numbers when you hit an enemy.
Disabling this may slightly improve performance if you're really struggling.
ui.settings.ui.show_experience_numbers.d:
Show experience numbers when you kill an enemy.
Disabling this may VERY slightly improve performance if you're really REALLY struggling.
ui.settings.ui.show_resource_numbers.des: Show the actual numbers for your resource bars on your HUD (e.g. health and stamina).
ui.settings.ui.show_keybind_reminders.de:
Shows the keybinds for certain important actions you can take.
(e.g. opening the map, using your flask)
ui.settings.sound.master.name: Master Volume
ui.settings.sound.music.name: Music
ui.settings.sound.music.description: Controls the volume of non-diagetic music within the game.
ui.settings.sound.effects.name: SFX
ui.settings.sound.effects.description:
Controls the volume of game related sounds.
Swords clashing, spells casting and enemies yelling, etc
ui.settings.sound.ui.name: UI
ui.settings.sound.ui.description:
Controls the volume for any UI related sounds.
Clicking on buttons in the menu, etc.
ui.settings.sound.voice.name: Voice
ui.settings.sound.voice.description: Controls how loud other players are over VOIP.
ui.settings.sound.enable_hitsounds.name: Hit Sounds
ui.settings.sound.enable_hitsounds.descr: Plays a sound whenever you successfull connect a hit on an enemy.
Allows armor to add an overlay sound to your footsteps.
Some people really hate these so you can turn them off here, or just reduce the volume.

Some of the armors in the game may have more grating sounds (e.g. chain mail)
This setting will turn off the ones I've specifically tagged as annyoing.
ui.settings.graphics.post_processing.des: Toggle all post processing effects on or off.
ui.settings.graphics.view_distance.name: View Distance
ui.settings.graphics.view_distance.descr:
Controls how far away from you dungeon tiles will draw.
Lower values will increase performance but may result in pop in.
ui.settings.graphics.volumetric_fog.name: Volumetric Fog
ui.settings.graphics.volumetric_fog.desc:
Whether volumetric fog is on or off.
This has a high performance impact, but it does look very cool...
ui.settings.graphics.screen_space_ambien:
Whether Screen Space Ambient Occlusion is on/off.
Ambient Occlusion darkens areas where shadows would naturally congregate, such as corners and sharp indents.
This has a mild performance impact.
ui.settings.graphics.screen_space_reflec:
Whether Screen Space Reflections is on/off.
This has a high performance impact and honestly I can't even really tell when it's on.
ui.settings.graphics.bloom.name: Bloom
ui.settings.graphics.bloom.description:
Whether Bloom is on/off.
Bloom has a moderate performance impact but it looks fuckin' awesome so I recommend leaving it on.
ui.settings.graphics.bloom_strength.name: Bloom Strength
ui.settings.graphics.bloom_strength.desc:
How strong the Bloom effect is.
I would recommend leaving this at 1 but I'm not your dad.
ui.settings.graphics.pixel_filter.name: Pixel Filter
ui.settings.graphics.pixel_filter.descri:
Whether the pixel filter is enabled or not.
The game is designed around this being enabled, but I understand some people really don't like it.
Feel free to tweak it to your liking :)
ui.settings.graphics.pixel_filter.resolu: How dense the pixel filter is. Higher value = higher resolution.
ui.settings.graphics.pixel_filter.colour:
How crunchy should the colours be? Lower = less possible colours.
And yes it's [key.flavour.important](COLOURS) not [key.flavour.negative](COLORS) ya fuckin' dogs.
ui.settings.graphics.contrast.name: Contrast
ui.settings.graphics.contrast.descriptio: Affects how strongly different color levels are represented in game - makes dark areas darker and bright areas brighter.
ui.settings.graphics.brightness.name: Brightness
ui.settings.graphics.saturation.name: Saturation
ui.settings.graphics.saturation.descript:
How 'deep' the colours should be. Higher saturation will result in colours appearing stronger and more vibrant, at the cost of possibly losing coherence and readability.
Lower saturation will wash out the colours, making things appear grey and monochromne.
